New Records: Gerardo Arteaga scored the winning goal for Mexico against Jamaica, helping them secure a 1-0 victory.
Key Match Events: Gerardo Arteaga scored the winning goal for Mexico in the 68th minute.
VAR called off Jamaica's goal in the 52nd minute due to Michail Antonio being offside.
Edson Alvarez was injured and subbed off in the 26th minute.
Luis Chávez had several attempts on goal, including a saved shot in the 56th minute and a blocked shot in the 54th minute.
Julián Quiñones had a blocked shot in the 47th minute and a saved shot in the 74th minute.
Gerardo Arteaga had a saved shot in the 63rd minute.
Santiago Giménez had a blocked shot in the 65th minute and a missed header in the 14th minute.
Orbelín Pineda had a blocked shot in the 35th minute and a free kick in the 66th minute.
Jorge Sánchez had a blocked shot in the 66th minute and a free kick in the 7th minute.
César Montes had a saved header in the 50th minute and a free kick in the 42nd minute.
Michail Antonio had a blocked shot in the 30th minute and a free kick in the 41st minute.
Shamar Nicholson had a missed header in the 20th minute and a blocked shot in the 55th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Mexico isn't a favorite in the tournament, but there is pressure to perform well for El Tri.
Jamaica is looking to spring the upset and break through in the tournament.
Mexico has participated in the Copa America 10 times, with a good amount of success overall, but hasn't made it past the quarterfinals since 2007.
Jamaica has only participated in two editions of the Copa America, in 2015 and 2016, and hasn't scored a single goal or earned a single point through six Copa America games in their history.
Post-Match Reflections: A big win for El Tri to start with a win.
Gerardo Arteaga came through with the winning goal.
Losing Edson Alvarez was a tough blow, but they rebounded and secured a 1-0 victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at NRG Stadium in Houston.
It was shown on FS1, Univision, and TUDN.
The second half was a furious start with both teams having big chances to score.
The biggest storyline was Edson Alvarez's health, who was subbed off in a lot of pain and his status for the tournament is now in doubt.
